Okay, Half-Life 2 is an excellent addition to the series, but I would prefer Half-Life 1 more. I only say that because Half-Life 1 is more alien stuff, and the retro look is appealing. Half-Life 2 is more of an overthrow the government type game, but it mixes stuff from the first game with it. Of course it's an amazing game, and anyone who liked the first one should give it a shot. It took me relatively the same time beating Half-Life 1 to beat Half-Life 2. Buy the DLCs too to get full story.

In comparison to its predecessor, Half Life 2 is an extraordinary game, but even on its own it is still an incredible experience. I had several gripes with the first installment, but this game has done away with them all. The source engine is a beautiful piece of technology that has put its mark on the gaming industry, and, back in the day, must have been a revolutionary development. I don't think Half-Life 2 would be the same without it.

That said, the game is very good. The gameplay is beyond solid, there's a good storyline to follow (with the exception that you receive little to no backstory on the entire ordeal), there are a few protagonist NPC's (all of whom have their own distinct and noticeable personality that you can love or hate), and the audio is good (though the amount of helicopter noise often drowns out other stuff).

Perhaps the one gripe i have with the series as a whole, is that very little is explained. Half Life 1 left me with many questions, and rather than getting answers, Half Life 2 has added many new uncertainties to the list. If there was ever to come a Half Life 3, it'd better have some knowledge bombs.

Either way, the game is recommended to everyone, especially since you can pick it up for around a buck or two during the sales.

Bueno este es el Half life 2 , simplemente la obra maestra de Valve y uno de los juegos que los puso en la cima del gaming por varios años, que hasta el día de hoy se ve el impacto que tuvo en los juegos actuales.

[h1]Aspectos positivos del juego[/h1]

1.Una de las mejores historias de todos los videojuegos que he podido jugar hasta la fecha con muchos personajes memorables.

2.Una buena duración que lleva de 8 a las 16 horas de juego ( En mi caso 21 ya que soy un pendejo) 

3.Una muy buena ambientación que nos lleva a los mas lejos de un futuro distópico donde el ser humano ya no es que el reina en lo que queda del planeta.

4.El juego sabe balancear muy bien las escenas de acción y los puzzles ( siento que esta entrega se inclina un poco más por la acción pero igual esta bien).

5.Un mundo más o menos abierto e interactivo donde puedes interactuar con casi todos los objetos y npc´s .

6.Una gran variedad de armas que probar que mediante tu avance podrás encontrar.

7.Una jugabilidad muy divertida.

[h1] Aspectos negativos del juego [/h1]

1.Un doblaje al español-españa simplemente terrible.

2.Algunos sin sentidos en la historia (Son pocos y no llegan a afectar la historia).

3.Algunos bugs y errores menores que no llegas a molestar mucho.

Eso seria casi todo lo que puedo mencionar de esta obra maestra que literalmente compro este juego junto con la orange box por el premiun del tf 2 en pocas palabras :
"Estaba buscando cobre y encontré oro"

9/10.

Valve's Source engine makes this 2004 game quite realistic to this day. The graphics held up surprisingly well, and the gameplay is just as fun as the first entry, with an even better storyline. Weapons like the Pheropod and RPG keep encounters fresh and interesting, and the Gravity Gun makes for some clever and funny ways to dispose of enemies.
